com.amitinside.featureflags

Interface FeatureManager


  • @ProviderType
public interface FeatureManager
    The FeatureManager service is the application access point to the feature flags functionality. It can be used to query the available features, configurations that contain these features. It is also used to manage these instances easily.
    See Also:
    Feature, FeatureConfiguration

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Optional<FeatureConfiguration> getConfiguration(String configurationPID)
      Returns the known FeatureConfiguration instance FeatureConfiguration instances are known if they comprise features
      Stream<FeatureConfiguration> getConfigurations()
      Retrieve all (known) FeatureConfiguration instances FeatureConfigurations are known if they comprise features
      Optional<Feature> getFeature(String configurationPID, String featureName)
      Returns the feature registered under the specified configuration PID with the given name Feature instances are known if they are registered with OSGi configuration.
      Stream<Feature> getFeatures(String configurationPID)
      Retrieve all (known) Feature instances registered under the provided configuration PID Features are known if they are configured with OSGi configuration under the specified configuration PID
      boolean updateFeature(String configurationPID, String featureName, boolean isEnabled)
      Updates the specified feature registered under the specified configuration PID

    • Method Detail

      • getConfigurations

        Stream<FeatureConfiguration> getConfigurations()
        Retrieve all (known) FeatureConfiguration instances

        FeatureConfigurations are known if they comprise features

        Returns:
        The known FeatureConfiguration instances

      • getFeatures

        Stream<Feature> getFeatures(String configurationPID)
        Retrieve all (known) Feature instances registered under the provided configuration PID

        Features are known if they are configured with OSGi configuration under the specified configuration PID

        Parameters:
        configurationPID - The configuration PID
        Returns:
        The known Feature instances
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the specified argument is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified argument is empty

      • getConfiguration

        Optional<FeatureConfiguration> getConfiguration(String configurationPID)
        Returns the known FeatureConfiguration instance

        FeatureConfiguration instances are known if they comprise features

        Parameters:
        name - The configuration PID
        Returns:
        The FeatureConfiguration wrapped in Optional or empty Optional instance if not known or the name is an empty string or null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the specified argument is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified argument is empty

      • getFeature

        Optional<Feature> getFeature(String configurationPID,
                             String featureName)
        Returns the feature registered under the specified configuration PID with the given name

        Feature instances are known if they are registered with OSGi configuration.

        Parameters:
        configurationPID - The configuration PID
        featureName - The name of the feature
        Returns:
        The Feature wrapped in Optional or empty Optional instance if not known or the name is an empty string or null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if any of the specified arguments is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if any of the specified arguments is empty

      • updateFeature

        boolean updateFeature(String configurationPID,
                      String featureName,
                      boolean isEnabled)
        Updates the specified feature registered under the specified configuration PID
        Parameters:
        configurationPID - The configuration PID
        featureName - The name of the feature
        isEnabled - the value for the enablement of the feature
        Returns:
        true if the feature is known and updated by this operation. Specifically false is also returned if the feature is not known or the operation failed to update the feature
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if any of the specified arguments is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if any of the specified arguments is empty
